column4: Umm ok everyone, my USB keyboard works fine, but my headset (plantronics dsp-500 USB headset) is not being detected on ubuntu. They work fine in Windows XP. Also my speakers are working (playing sound) perfectly fine, so the sound is working. Could anyone assist me in fixing this problem?
*sorry meant to say paste the *output* into #flood or a pastebin
have you watched for the appearance and disappearance of any new items in the Device Manager when you plug and unplug the headset?
(Ubuntu device manager, not Windows)
hm. okay, let's see the output of lsusb instead
check the flood channel
hm, that's it?
and it can't be loose wires...
try typing dmesg and then paste the last ten or fifteen lines into #flood
check #flood channel
well, it does say "registered new driver snd-usb-audio" which is a good sign. maybe you just aren't choosing the proper soundcard to output to, in the program that you're using?
(not sure how to do that, as I only have one sound card, and it's been a while since I've had two, so everything's changed)
bizarre. I'm not sure...
one last thing to paste: could you paste the output of lsmod into #flood?
ok i posted in flood
gee whiz
I can't see anything wrong
looks okay to me
its still not playing in the headset yet
u there
X is the server that gives you graphics instead of text
